results.title: Scent of a woman
results.creator_credit: Martin Brest, City Lights Films and Universal Pictures
results.brief_description: It’s thanksgiving weekend in New York and Lt. Colonel Frank Slade (Al Pacino) is in town for a slice of the good life: fine cuisine, beautiful women chauffered limousines and a suite at the Waldorf-Astoria. The naive and young Charlie Simms (Chris O’Donnell) is reluctantly along for the ride, getting the education of a lifetime. Slade is one of life’s true originals, now blind, irascible yet with a touch of the poet. Charlie is an earnest young prep student facing a difficult crossroads in his life. Their raucous, revealing and at times hysterical adventure in New York will leave them both changed forever.

results.title: Moonstruck
results.creator_credit: Norman Jewison, Patrick Palmer and Metro-Goldwyn-Mayer
results.brief_description: A delightful romantic comedy which warms the heart. Cher plays Loretta Castorini, widowed at a young age due to “bad luck”. Engaged to timid Johnny Cammareri (Danny Aiello), Loretta attempts to mend the estrangement between Johnny and his brother Ronny. Instead, she falls in love with Ronny (Nicholas Cage). “Moonstruck” takes us into the hearts and minds of a loving Brooklyn-Italian family, sharing their dramas, tragedies and joys. “La bella Luna”, the moon, forms a romantic backdrop for the turbulent affairs of the heart and creates an atmosphere where anything can happen, and does! Co-starring Vincent Gardenia and Olympia Dukakis.

results.title: Love story
results.creator_credit: Arthur Hiller, Howard G. Minsky and Paramount Pictures
results.brief_description: Eric Segal’s best-selling novel adapted for the silver screen, became one of the most famous and loved “tear jerkers” of cinema history. Starring Ali MacGraw and Ryan O’Neal, they play a young college couple, Jenny and Oliver. The story chronicles their love as they overcome the obstacles of different social status, their marriage and ultimate separation when death claims Jenny. Nominated for seven Academy Awards, the film co-stars Ray Milland and John Marley. The haunting theme song became a hit classic of the movies.

results.title: Irma La Douce
results.creator_credit: Orry-Kelly, Daniel Mandell, Billy Wilder, Edward Alperson and Mirisch Corporation
results.brief_description: Comedy set in the red-light district of Paris, where Irma La Douce (Shirley MacLaine) is a “working girl”. A naive gendarme (Jack Lemmon) falls for the beautiful Irma after conducting a one-man raid on a notorious backstreet establishment. He becomes Irma’s “business manager” but soon becomes insanely jealous of her clientele and in despair, devises a clever way to keep her all to himself. MacLaine and Lemmon display their impressive comic talents under Billy Wilder’s direction. This screen adaptation was based on the successful Broadway musical.

results.title: At play in the fields of the Lord
results.creator_credit: Hector Babenco, Saul Zaentz and Saul Zaentz Company
results.brief_description: Tom Berenger, Daryl Hannah and Aidan Quinn star in a powerful story of mercenaries, missionaries and a tribe of primitive Indians who clash in fanatical conflict in the remote and unforgiving forest of Amazonia. A tragic chain of events is set in motion when the modern world intrudes on the rainforest and its indigenous people. Shot entirely on location in the Amazon forest.

results.title: Darling
results.creator_credit: John Schlesinger, Joseph Janni and Embassy Pictures Corporation (US)
results.brief_description: Julie Christie won an Academy Award for her performance as an ambitious young model who uses all her assets to achieve social successs. Ultimately, she finds that the life to which she aspired is meaningless and empty. Her relationships with journalist Dirk Bogarde, company director Laurence Harvey, an effeminate photographer and an Italian Prince are never really satisfying. “Darling” was groundbreaking in its time because it exposed the “swinging 60’s” with its more “modern” attitudes towards sexuality, homosexuality and infidelity in a frank and adult manner. The viewer may be left feeling that Christie’s character is shallow and cold despite her vulnerabilty, and that the emptiness of her life is of her own making.

results.title: Impromptu
results.creator_credit: James Lapine, Daniel A. Sherkow, Stuart Oken, Les Films Ariane, Governor Productions and Sovereign Pictures
results.brief_description: Two lovers could never be more different than the cross-dressing, cigar-smoking writer George Sand (Judy Davis) and the frail, romantic Frederic Chopin (Hugh Grant). The greatest creative minds of all time - including Liszt (Julian Sands), Delacroix (Ralph Brown) and de Musset (Mandy Patinkin) come together for one wild fortnight. The lustful Marie d’Agoult (Bernadette Peters) decides to amuse herself and with her mischievous scheming there is no telling who will end up with who! The outcome is scandalous even by today’s standards - an outrageous sex farce that portrays the greatest geniuses with sexual appetites as powerful as their creative fervour. Co-starring Georges Corraface, Anton Rodgers and Emma Thompson.

results.title: Deep red
results.creator_credit: Dario Argento, Spettacoli, Salvatore Argento and Rizzoli Film
results.brief_description: Dario Argento’s blood thirsty thriller stars British actor David Hemmings. Witnessing the violent murder of a young parapsychologist, Hemmings embarks on a search for the murderer by following the trail of blood and destruction. “Deep red” is a film of relentless tension, with a bizarre ending and contains some of cinema’s most gripping film sequences. Italian dialogue. Dubbed in English.

results.title: Diary of a chambermaid
results.creator_credit: Jean Renoir, Benedict Bogeaus, Burgess Meredith and Republic Films
results.brief_description: Chambermaid Celestine, (Paulette Goddard), a determined young woman wanting to improve her position and willing to use all her assets to do so. She climbs her way up through the various men in her life; her weak master Monsieur Lanlaire (Reginald Owen), his frail son George, (Hurd Hatfield), an eccentric flower-eating farmer/soldier Captain Mauger (Burgess Meredith), and the ruthless valet Joseph (Francis Lederer). What ensues is scandal, blackmail and murder. This was Renoir’s fourth American film, based on the novel by Octave Mirabeau.

results.title: Heaven's gate
results.creator_credit: Michael Cimino, Joan Carell and United Artists Corporation
results.brief_description: Heaven’s gate is one of the most talked-about films in cinema history and based on events which occurred in Wyoming in 1892 when ruthless ranchers decided to kill starving immigrants who had been stealing cattle. Kris Kristofferson and Christopher Walken play lawman and hitman on opposite sides of the struggle, who share the love of Ella, played by Isabelle Huppert. The original film was cut by 70 minutes and was never acclaimed in the United States as it was in Europe. This version is presented in its entirety and has compelling performances by the supporting cast of John Hurt, Jeff Bridges and Sam Waterston and locational shoots of breathtaking beauty.
